user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_add_response_header:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_add_response_header (struct MHD_Response *response,
                         const char *header,
                         const char *content)
{
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONNECTION))
    return add_response_header_connection (response, content);

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_TRANSFER_ENCODING))
  {
    if (! MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (content, "chunked"))
      return MHD_NO;   /* Only "chunked" encoding is allowed */
    if (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED))
      return MHD_YES;  /* Already has "chunked" encoding header */
    if ( (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH)) &&
         (0 == (MHD_RF_INSANITY_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH & response->flags)) )
      return MHD_NO; /* Has "Content-Length" header and no "Insanity" flag */
    if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (response,
                                      MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                      header,
                                      content))
    {
      response->flags_auto |= MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED;
      return MHD_YES;
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_DATE))
  {
    if (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_DATE_HDR))
    {
      struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *hdr;
      hdr = MHD_get_response_element_n_ (response, MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                         MHD_HTTP_HEADER_DATE,
                                         MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ( \
                                           MHD_HTTP_HEADER_DATE));
      mhd_assert (NULL != hdr);
      _MHD_remove_header (response, hdr);
      if (NULL != hdr->value)
        free (hdr->value);
      free (hdr->header);
      free (hdr);
    }
    if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (response,
                                      MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                      header,
                                      content))
    {
      response->flags_auto |= MHD_RAF_HAS_DATE_HDR;
      return MHD_YES;
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH))
  {
    /* Generally MHD sets automatically correct "Content-Length" always when
     * needed.
     * Custom "Content-Length" header is allowed only in special cases. */
    if ( (0 != (MHD_RF_INSANITY_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH & response->flags)) ||
         ((0 != (MHD_RF_HEAD_ONLY_RESPONSE & response->flags)) &&
          (0 == (response->flags_auto & (MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED
                                         | MHD_RAF_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH)))) )
    {
      if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (response,
                                        MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                                        header,
                                        content))
      {
        response->flags_auto |= MHD_RAF_HAS_CONTENT_LENGTH;
        return MHD_YES;
      }
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }

  return add_response_entry (response,
                             MHD_HEADER_KIND,
                             header,
                             content);
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I found no controlling expressions that are clearly invariant and thus no fragments that need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3. Reasoning by construct:

- There are no iteration statements (for, while, do-while) whose controlling expressions are constant. The function contains only if statements and return statements.

- Every if-condition depends on runtime data or function calls, not on compile-time constant expressions:
  - if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONNECTION)) — depends on the runtime value of header and the behavior of MHD_str_equal_caseless_.
  - if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_ (header, MHD_HTTP_HEADER_TRANSFER_ENCODING)) and the nested checks (e.g., ! MHD_str_equal_caseless_(content, "chunked")) — depend on runtime values and function calls.
  - The bitwise flag checks such as (0 != (response->flags_auto & MHD_RAF_HAS_TRANS_ENC_CHUNKED)) and (0 == (MHD_RF_INSANITY_HEADER_CONTENT_LENGTH & response->flags)) read the runtime response->flags fields; these are not invariant at compile time.
  - if (MHD_NO != add_response_entry (...)) — the controlling expression includes a function call (add_response_entry) with potential side effects and runtime result; it is not a compile-time constant.
  - Date/header handling branches similarly rely on MHD_str_equal_caseless_, MHD_get_response_element_n_, and response fields which are runtime-dependent.

- The mhd_assert (NULL != hdr); statement is not a controlling selection/iteration statement in this function (it is an assertion macro), and its argument is a runtime pointer check produced after a call to MHD_get_response_element_n_. Even if mhd_assert expands to something involving a conditional internally, that expansion is outside the shown code and cannot be assumed to be an invariant controlling expression here.

- There is no do-while with a constant false controlling expression (the listed MISRA exception) or any other allowed exception pattern present.

Given these points, none of the controlling expressions in the provided function are evidently compile-time invariant; therefore there are no fragments to report for further investigation under Rule 14.3.
